common_issues.title: Pieces OS 10.1.15 Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various bugs with Pieces OS 10.1.15, including issues with the right tray icons appearing when resizing, demo chats getting stuck loading after skipping onboarding, and Copilot not generating responses. Troubleshooting steps vary depending on the specific problem, and some issues are still under investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Claire is experiencing an issue where they cannot see the video posted in the issue.
* Mason believes the issue is related to the two icons appearing in the corner of Copilot.

**Problems identified:**

* Claire cannot see the video embedded in the issue.
* The reason for the missing video is unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mason suggests that the issue might be related to the two icons appearing in Copilot. 
* Claire confirms that this solves the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved. 
* Claire can now see the video embedded in the issue. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place on December 11th, 2024. 
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member. 
* Claire was provided with links to relevant resources.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Issue:** 
- Chats are empty after restarting pOS and PfD.

**Key Points:**
- User (hra42) reported empty chats after restarting.
- Screenshots provided showing the issue.
- User confirmed that the chat functionality works as expected otherwise.

**Problems Identified:**
- Potential failure in the process of creating demo conversations.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
- Investigating the issue further.
- Replicating the setup and configuration to diagnose the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
- Open issue, awaiting further investigation by mack-at-pieces.

**Additional Notes:**
- User provided information about the setup (macOS VM on Parallels).
- Related issues and resources suggested by the bot.

common_issues.title: Pieces Onboarding and Demo Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces onboarding, including blank demo chats, failure to generate onboarding pieces, and 'Context Exceeded' errors. These issues may stem from incomplete resets, skipping onboarding steps, or problems with specific model versions. Solutions include deleting all related folders upon reset, ensuring complete onboarding, and waiting for upcoming releases with fixes.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User hra42 is encountering an issue with Pieces onboarding process after deleting the local database but not the com.pieces.pfd folder.
* This specific issue is causing a PERMISSION_DENIED error with the cloud services.

**Identified Problems:**

* Skipping the generation of onboarding snippets and conversations when the com.pieces.pfd folder is not deleted.
* PERMISSION_DENIED error preventing further progress.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Deleting the com.pieces.pfd folder along with the local database.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for the user hra42 after deleting the com.pieces.pfd folder.
* The root cause of the PERMISSION_DENIED error requires further investigation to ensure complete resolution.

**Additional Information:**

* The user had previously closed pOS and PfD and deleted the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folders before restarting both applications.

related_issues.title: PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
related_issues.text:
PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

On first use of PFD v. 3.2.4 after completing the install wizard, I get a "Context exceeded" error with a short message to copilot in empty chat using (using default model `Claude Sonnet 3.5`) 

Repro 
1. fresh install of PDF on MacOS
2. complete wizard with defaults
3. in chat opened on load, ask default model Claude Sonnet 3.5 "Yo world"

May be related to #487 , but creating separate issue as it relates to onboarding

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/481c3e22-5e84-436d-b81a-4f8bfdc88083

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Claire reported an issue with Pieces AI not generating responses in certain contexts.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces support team.
* Mark identified the issue as a duplicate of another reported problem.
* The solution is included in the next PiecesOS release.

**Problems:**

* Pieces AI failing to generate responses in specific contexts.

**Solutions:**

* Issue will be fixed in the next PiecesOS update.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is marked as a duplicate and will be resolved in the next release.

**Outcome:**

* Users will experience improved response generation from Pieces AI after the update.

common_issues.title: Claude LLM Context Exceeded Error
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing "Context exceeded" errors when using the Claude LLM in the Pieces desktop application on Linux and macOS. This issue occurs even with short messages and during onboarding. The problem is linked to a known issue and is expected to be resolved in an upcoming Pieces OS release.

related_issues.title: Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
related_issues.text:
Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/262696c2-c641-4337-9966-abdc4fb18739)
I'm getting this error every time I try to use the Claude LLM. What's the problem?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @dhruv465 reported a problem with receiving a "Context exceeded" error.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant team member.
* The team identified the issue as a duplicate of https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/487.
* The issue is expected to be resolved in the next release, scheduled for late this week or early next week.

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to proceed due to the "Context exceeded" error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was closed as a duplicate of an existing issue.
* The existing issue is scheduled to be resolved in the next release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently closed and awaiting the next release.
* The user is advised to upgrade to the next release for the resolution.
* No further action is required from the user at this time.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Failing to Launch or Connect
common_issues.description: Users are reporting that Pieces OS is getting stuck on "Connecting..." or failing to launch entirely. This issue appears to affect both the desktop application and VS Code extension. Proposed solutions include checking for updates, ensuring Pieces OS is allowed through the firewall, and verifying Pieces OS is running. Further investigation and logs may be required for specific cases.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Andrea3i reported that the OS toolbar is not launching.
* The issue was initially thought to be related to the Visual Studio plugin.
* Further investigation revealed a deeper problem with how applets are hosted.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Visual Studio plugin was causing a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS couldn't choose the correct ports to serve the webviews.
* Dart language SDK wasn't returning the actual OS error code.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Released Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 to fix the UI thread hang.
* Released Pieces OS version 10.1.15 to improve port selection for webviews.
* Scheduled a screen recording with Andrea3i to gather more information.
* Requested Andrea3i to run a utility to retrieve the OS error code.
* Investigated potential issues like lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and permission restrictions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The initial solutions didn't resolve the issue for Andrea3i.
* Further investigation is needed with the scheduling of a screen recording and running a utility for the error code.
* The root cause is still being investigated with several potential problems identified.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Crashing and White Screen Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop App crashing, failing to load, or encountering a white screen on Windows 11. Proposed solutions include reinstalling the app, sharing application data, and troubleshooting live with developers. However, the issue persists for some users. Developers are actively investigating and seeking user logs for debugging.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Conversation summary: 

**Problem:**

- Some users are experiencing a white screen instead of the Pieces desktop application. 

**Proposed solutions:**

- Sharing a local application data folder. 
- Re-installing the latest desktop app (version 3.1.0).
- Troubleshooting with a developer live. 

**Current status/outcome:**

- Issue not resolved for all.
- Developer available for live troubleshooting sessions to further diagnose and fix the issue.

**Key points:**

- Sharing the application data folder did not solve the issue for some users.
- The issue is still ongoing.
- A new desktop app version was released with performance improvements.
- Developer is actively seeking to help users resolve the problem.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## GitHub Issue Summary: Files/Folders as Context

**Key Points:**

* Issue reported by @omkar-4 regarding file/folder context causing crashes.
* Author experienced crashes with Pieces for Devs Desktop App.
* Support team acknowledges similar issues in the past, but difficulty in reproducing them.

**Problems Identified:**

* Crashes related to files/folders as context.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue due to dependence on specific files/folders.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team requests user to share the files/folders causing the issue.
* This would help in reproducing and debugging the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains open, awaiting user response with the requested files/folders.

**Additional Notes:**

* Support team provided links to similar issues and helpful resources.

related_issues.title: Not Working
related_issues.text:
Not Working
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest 

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99814116-7444-4cb0-8666-86b81dd9f580)
Its Keep on showing connecting and its not getting connected and it gets stck
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Ganesh-2-4 encountered an issue with Pieces.app.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue caused by a bug.
* Logs needed for debugging.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @rosie-at-pieces asked @Ganesh-2-4 to send logs for troubleshooting.
* The support team will investigate the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Logs requested from the user.
* Pending further investigation and resolution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests the issue was encountered on November 14, 2024. 
* The issue was reported through a GitHub conversation.
* The support team will address the issue via email (support@pieces.app).

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS 10.1.15 bugs:** This version has the most reported issues, impacting user experience across multiple features (right tray icons, demo chats, Copilot responses).

**Investigate and address onboarding issues:** Problems with onboarding, including blank demo chats and 'Context Exceeded' errors, are causing user frustration early on. Resolving these will improve user adoption and satisfaction.
**Provide clear workarounds for Claude LLM context errors:** While a fix is planned, offer users temporary solutions like using alternative LLMs or breaking down prompts.

**Improve Pieces OS stability and launch process:** Address issues with Pieces OS getting stuck on "Connecting..." or failing to launch, especially for the desktop app and VS Code extension. This may involve investigating firewall conflicts, update processes, and providing clearer error messages.

**Gather more information on Desktop App crashes:** Request detailed logs from users experiencing crashes and white screens on Windows 11 to help developers identify the root cause and implement a fix.

**Review and update documentation:** Ensure troubleshooting steps for common issues are up-to-date and easy to find. This includes information on resetting Pieces, resolving firewall issues, and understanding onboarding processes.
**Consider creating a dedicated FAQ for Pieces OS 10.1.15:** Given the number of issues reported, a dedicated FAQ section can centralize troubleshooting information and reduce support ticket volume.
**Monitor and analyze ticket trends:** Regularly analyze support tickets to identify recurring issues and prioritize development efforts based on user impact and frequency.
